result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Vern A Ponto was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vern A Ponto

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: To defendant from Clerk dated August 10, 2017 - IID exemption form and cover letter.
Defendant phoned the office and requested a blank IID exemption form. Mailed to defendant same day. Address on file verified.
for ignition interlock exemptions and removing title transfer stops

2:32 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Anthony O'Malley.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 and counts 1 & 3 will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty O'Malley concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2.  Court orders count 1 & 3 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No objection by Atty O'Malley.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-28 days county jail, with huber.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.
-$500 fine plus court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 16 months
-IID - 16 months
-AODA (FDL)
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 2:40 p.m.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: from Atty Anthony O'Malley - requests the status hearing scheduled on 04/04 at 11:30 a.m. be rescheduled (ORIGINAL)
from Atty Anthony O'Malley - requests the status hearing scheduled on 04/04 at 11:30 a.m. be rescheduled (FAX COPY)
Status hearing on April 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

8:45 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on February 22, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:48 a.m.
